Title: Integral ${\large\int}_0^\infty\frac{dx}{\sqrt[4]{7+\cosh x}}$
Content:
How to prove the following conjectured identity?
$$\int_0^\infty\frac{dx}{\sqrt[4]{7+\cosh x}}\stackrel{\color{#a0a0a0}?}=\frac{\sqrt[4]6}{3\sqrt\pi}\Gamma^2\big(\tfrac14\big)\tag1$$
It holds numerically with precision of at least $1000$ decimal digits. Are there any other integers under the radical except $7$ and $1$ that result in a nice closed form?
